sentences.en: Big boys sometimes domineer over the younger pupils.
sentences.cn: 大男孩有时会蛮横地对待较年幼的小学生.

sentences.en: He tried to domineer over everyone.
sentences.cn: 他想对任何人都专横跋扈.

sentences.en: I wouldn't work for someone who tries to domineer over everyone as Mr , Smith does.
sentences.cn: 像史密斯那种总想支配别人的人,我不愿为他作事.

sentences.en: It pleased me to domineer over her, and she generally submitted to my tyranny rather than risk a hand-to-hand encounter.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢对她作威作福，而她通常宁可屈从我的专横，不愿冒著和我直接冲突的危险。

words.tran_cn: 跋扈的；专横的；盛气凌人的
实行暴政；高耸；流行（domineer的ing形式）

trans.tran_en: to act with arrogance or tyranny; behave imperiously
